name: Scotchies Jerk Centre
description: If you're a foodie looking for an authentic Jamaican culinary experience, look no further than Scotchies Jerk Centre. Here, you'll get to indulge in succulent, smoky jerk chicken, pork, and fish cooked over pimento wood and served with traditional sides like festival and breadfruit. Enjoy your meal in a rustic, laid-back atmosphere that perfectly captures the island's charm and hospitality.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Was a line BUT worth the wait.  Would visit again next time on tour.  Very good atmosphere and staff was ready to serve.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Good food

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The jerk chicken is so good! High recommend! The sauce is given on the side. It is really spicy. I love spicy so it was fine for me. The rice and pea was dry and tasted a little old. The restaurant is outside so, be ready to fight for your life with the flies lol oh and make sure you have Jamaican money with you. They will say the card machine is down to charge extra. The woman told us only total was $3,500 Jamaica dollars and told us it was $27 in America money when actually it was $23 in America money.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A delicious treat with a side of scam

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Scotchies is the best stop for lunch or dinner. They offer the best jerk chicken and jerk pork along with other meals. This placemus a must go to.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Best Jerk chicken and Pork

user_location.name: Montego Bay, Saint James Parish, Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Food was ok. Ribs weren’t that meaty though but other than that, was a good stop. I love the coco bread and roasted yams. Her pork was very juicy
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Good food

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This spot is consistently good the staff is very friendly, the food is so good and it's fresh. I don't go to Jamaica without a visit to Scotchies.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Very good food!

address_obj.address_string: Falmouth Road, Montego Bay Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #7 of 160 Places to Eat in Montego Bay

name: The Houseboat Grill, Seasfood Restaurant
description: For a unique dining experience, head to the House Boat Grill, a floating seafood restaurant located on the waters of Montego Bay. Feast on fresh seafood caught by local fishermen, including lobster, shrimp, and fish, while taking in panoramic views of the Caribbean Sea. You can choose to dine in air-conditioned comfort or al fresco on the upper deck, with the sea breeze and stunning sunsets adding to the atmosphere.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: My partner and I went to the Houseboat Grill on Sunday for dinner, and  our weekly date night. What a lovely evening we had. On arrival you take a little boat like raft over to the main boat where you will eat your meal, this takes seconds. The food takes about twenty five minutes to get to the table but you are advsied about the wait time. The food was lovely we had the baked fish and the surf and turf and warm bananna cake for pudding. It is a delightful view we were seated outside the boat. The wait staff are very pleasant and very accommodating. Please be aware you may be bitten by the mosquito's they ate me alive but the staff have a repellant spray at hand. This is a lovely place to have dinner with beautiful views, we would definitely eat here again.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A very nice evening.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Visited the houseboat grill with my partner & when I’m telling you from once we’ve arrived we were greeted by the ferry service personnel who accompanied us unto the boat. We were then seated by a hostess which was very polite of her. Melissha our server & Mario our bartender are very pleasant, understandable, even though melissha is NEW she has great customer service. She checked on us throughout the entire evening to ensure that we were great. On the other hand, Mario our bartender, serve us our drinks which was well mix & prepared. The food was awesome & you could taste the love in it. It was my partner’s birthday & they came out singing happy birthday along with a well plated candled lava cake. We then asked to speak with the manager (Olivia) to express our gratitude & satisfaction we experienced. She’s a good listener & pleasant individual, it was very nice meeting her. We loved this place & 100% recommend it. From the view down to the service is immaculate, will definitely return.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Birthday celebration

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Excellent seafood place!  I bought a round of tequila for the staff when we arrived and they were very appreciative!  Good calamari, and seafood pasta!  Very clean and safe!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Fun experience, friendly staff!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Love you is beautiful, but the service is slow and the food was just OK. Prices were high, and in my opinion it wasn’t worth it.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Just ok

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We called in here on the way back to our hotel from an excursion. I’ll start by saying the concept is great! Really cool getting the little ferry over to the boat.

We told the waitress we just wanted to have a drink not dinner. We were seated upstairs and told the bartender will be up soon. 10 minutes later he arrives (ok- we are getting used to island time no big deal.) we ordered two cocktails- nothing over complicated or time consuming to make one was an old fashioned. 20 minutes later STILL NO SIGN of our drinks!we agreed if it gets to 30 minutes we will walk out as this is ridiculous.

My husband went downstairs and seen the bartender was making the drinks. So we continued to wait. At this stage I didn’t even want it as the whole point was a quick drink before we go back to our hotel. After37 minutes we got our drinks. Asked for the bill and it was another 15. 

After reading some of the other reviews I’m glad we didn’t book here for food and the slow service of the drinks has totally put me off. It’s a shame.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wait time ridiculous

address_obj.address_string: Southern Cross Blvd, Montego Bay Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #5 of 161 Places to Eat in Montego Bay

name: Pork Pit Bar & Grill
description: Meat lovers will appreciate the Pork Pit Bar & Grill, a casual eatery serving up juicy, flavourful pork dishes, including classic jerk and barbecue options. The pork is slow-cooked over an open fire pit, giving it that unmistakable smoky taste, and is accompanied by sides such as festival, plantains, and rice and peas. Wash it all down with a cold Red Stripe beer or a tropical cocktail.

address_obj.address_string: 27 Gloucester Ave, Miranda Hill, Montego Bay Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #8 of 160 Places to Eat in Montego Bay

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Heard about this place on YouTube and suggested to our friend if he could bring us here. SO glad we went! We ordered jerk chicken, jerk pork, festival and Red Stripe. You go in and order, then you get the receipt and bring it out to the pit and give it to the cook. You can see the meats cooking on the coals/sweetwood and the smoky smell just makes you drool! I wish we ordered one of everything lol! Especially the sausage. The food was delicious! We would definitely go back in a heartbeat.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Meatatarians, unite!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I’m sorry to say that this is an overhyped tourist trap. It is a very pricey place. I ordered jerk  and BBQ wings and fries and clearly they were all old. I had some jerk chicken and it was also mediocre. There is also a woman who sells goods outside the place who is very pushy and will try to rip you off if you haggle with her on her overpriced souvenirs (that are not unique) so beware.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Meh. I would say pass

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Very friendly , clean looking atmosphere . The customer services is very good. Great and delicious food .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: The price was reasonable and very accurate and affordable. I would definitely go  again .

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
One of the best meals we had in Jamaica. Absolutely no frills. You get well seasoned pork and some options for sides. It’s nice to be able to watch them smoking the pork over wood. If you’re staying nearby, I might get food to go instead of eating here. 
While the food was good, there were lots of flies at the tables and smoke was heavy at times. 
Cheap red stripe, good plantains, and of course good pork.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Authentic, tasty, cheap

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Food is good. That's the only thing that's good. Staff are not polite and more interested in their phones. Sides can take up to 45 minutes if they don't forget about it. Would rather go to Scotchies for better service and food.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Waste of time and money

name: Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville
description: For a lively, fun-filled atmosphere, check out Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville, a popular restaurant and bar with locations all over the world. Here, you can sip on margaritas and other tropical drinks, swim in the pool, dance to live music, and even take a ride on the water slide. The food menu includes both Caribbean and American favourites, with dishes like conch fritters and burgers.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Turquoise waters summon you to the shores of Jamaica’s second largest city and first choice for fun, Montego Bay. From your resort or cruise ship, journey to the heart of MoBay’s Hip Strip by bus, taxi, catamaran—even foot—for an exhilarating daylong retreat the whole family will enjoy. Classic Americana and authentic jerk dishes served with a side of Island time. Ice-cold drinks paired with red-hot fun, and panoramic views of the Caribbean that offer unlimited opportunities for heart-pumping water sports from our aqua park. Hear the call of the ocean from our 120-foot waterslide. Jump for joy on our water trampoline. Grab the day by the margarita mug and let loose. From island-inspired bites on our famed sunset patio to dancehall and reggae beats under the moonlight at our seaside nightclub, you won’t want to let another day waste away without visiting Margaritaville Montego Bay.

address_obj.address_string: M19 Southern Cross Boulevard Freeport Montego Bay, Montego Bay Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #20 of 160 Places to Eat in Montego Bay

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Perfect spot to watch the sunset.
Lounge all day, party all night!
Take a ride down our slide!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Good music and views.  Plenty of staff, they just aren't being managed and stand around and don't get anything done.  To bad, because this place could be great.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: OK place, nice view, service is terrible.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I went with a couple of ladies and I had burger and fries--more than enough and the ladies ordered the nachos which would easily feed 3-4 people.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Always GREAT

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Was so exhausted to go here before I even arrived in Montego Bay. Got there and sat down, took about 20 mins for drinks to arrive (plus they ran out of souvenir cups so I made my mind up for 1 drink as it’s ridiculous prices) - I ordered fish tacos which were beautiful. Kept getting asked to get a picture but I knew they charged and didn’t want to have to pay. Music was country songs which was brilliant but the DJ would not stop talking - bearing in mind it was 1pm not 1am. Came to $11,250 (Jamaican dollars) - gave the waitress $12,000 expecting my change I was going to tip maybe $1,000. Lo and behold the waitress never brought me my money back at all which is so wrong in any country. So that ruined my mood. Then I was actually surprised there was no beach and only 4/5 Sun loungers down some dodgy stairs looking into the water. The slide is a serious hazard so I stayed away from it. Also from the pictures - a bunch of the water ‘obstacle course’ was missing. 
Sad to say I was incredibly disappointed and was hoping to go back multiple times and make use of the free shuttle there from the hotel. That won’t be the case - from what I’ve seen go to the other ones in Jamaica!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Hugely Disappointing -Wanted to love it but left a sour taste!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Wanted to give something a try that wasn’t on our hotel property.

Beautiful place as the water is clear and it has a water activists.

Food is decent

However I wanted a souvenir glass but they were sold out of all glasses. You would think with the amount of tourists they have they would be well stocked.

It gets busy with the tour boats coming in and docking.

I think this restaurant is more geared to +18 

Long story short we tried it, it was fine but probably not go back.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Something do to off property

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We have visited over a dozen Margaritavilles and loved them.......but not this one. The true spirit of the place doesn't exist. Within 5 minutes of arrival we were pounced on by an over zealous cameraman demanding all manner of poses. He then wanted $25 for photos and wouldn't take no for an answer. The Jamaicans have several polite ways of telling folks to go away but in this case the old familiar two worded suggestion was required.
Then a clown on stilts wanted money as he thought we had taken his picture....as if. The drinks, food and shop are heavily overpriced and service stops when a boat trip moors up.It is the only Margaritaville where they don't play Jimmy Buffett music 
When presented with my bill I was instructed to choose 20, 25, or 30%  as a tip . Considering the poor service I refused. We were then told by the server that she wasn't paid and worked for tips.
I suggested that she have  meeting with her boss who is one of the richest blokes in the US and has recently been classified as a billionaire
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Don't waste away again in this Margaritaville

name: The Pelican Grill, Jamaican Restaurant
description: For more than 50 years, The Pelican Grill has been serving up classic Jamaican dishes with a touch of elegance. The restaurant's upscale atmosphere and impeccable service set it apart, while the menu offers a range of seafood, meat, and vegetarian options, all prepared with the freshest local ingredients. Don't miss the grilled lobster or the traditional ackee and saltfish dish.

アキー＆ソルトフィッシュ、バナナ、ヤム芋、ブルマン

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This open air restaurant was our biggest surprise in Jamaica. We couldn’t stop going there. In fact, we had breakfast, lunch and dinner there because we were staying at the Associated bed and breakfast, Polkerris. The combination of the two made our stay memorable. We went to supposedly “better” restaurants in other areas, but we never had a better meal. The traditional Jamaican dishes are awesome. But the other dishes are also amazing including the sweet and sour chicken and shrimp. We rated most of the menu and ended our evenings with the milkshakes (epic) or the decadent coconut cream pie. All truly amazing!!!! I love this place. Thank you to the proprietors for making our stay in Jamaica so amazing.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Best Food in Jamaica

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The service and ambiance was good. Like most of the resaurants we visited, the food was ok but didn't blow us away.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Just ok

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Visited here for dinner on 14th of Feb.  

Plenty of options on the menu. Portions were big and very tasty. Good value for money. 

Staff were friendly and personable. 

Seemed to be a mixture of locals and tourists eating which was good to see.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Enjoyable evening

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I can't say enough about the Pelican Grill!  There are so many selections on the menu and they cater to all tastes!  Food is always prepared perfectly and the portions are very generous!  The service  is what brings you in as  well, big  shout outs to David  and  Cordel, they are just wonderful and help round out our visit every time!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: For your Best Meal

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We arrived a little after 5 and several tables were taken by locals will known to the staff. Always a good first sign. Appy of jerk shrimp spring roll and mango wings were perfect. Entrees of jerk chicken and salt fish were fine. But the rum pudding (bread pudding) was the topper. Reasonable price and very good service

The server continued to apologize throughout. I thought I'd try the steak for a change. It was very tender but the whole meal was cold. My brother ordered the civiche whole fish. name: Usain Bolts Tracks & Records Restaurant
description: Named after the world-famous Jamaican sprinter, Usain Bolt's Tracks & Records Restaurant offers a mix of Jamaican and international cuisine in a sleek, modern setting. The menu includes a range of options, from jerk chicken and oxtail to sushi and pizza, while the bar offers an extensive list of cocktails, including some created by Bolt himself. Sports fans will appreciate the memorabilia and decor featuring Bolt's achievements.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Four of us went in and all had great meals, food was lovely, staff were friendly, the place was clean and you didn’t get hassled as in some places.
Quite reasonable prices as well being as it’s a themed restaurant.
One thing I didn’t like is done one asked if we wanted weed halfway thru our meal, not sure if they worked there or not, apart from that we had a really nice meal
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Nice food and atmosphere

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Went to tracks and record last night for a dinner party with my family and few close friends.. Everyone ordered their meal and patiently waited. 

The food came.. Then out of nowhere my little niece said "something smells dead" and made a gagging sound. The jerk chicken smelled like a decaying 🐕. it's been a few hours and the smell is still lingering with us. How does one serve spoiled chicken and had the decency to give us a poor a** excuse that you don't know how it happened. How many ppl ate the jerk chicken that day.  My advice when eating out be cautious and smell your food. Inspect it. Cuz these restaurants out here trying to ☠️ us.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: SPOILED MEAT ON A PLATTER

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The Swiss burger was good but I might not order it again as compared to the escovitch burger, there really is no comparison. Jourdan is an amazing bartender so I am never disappointed where drinks are concerned.

name: Mystic Thai, Indian & Thai Restaurant
description: If you're in the mood for something different, Mystic Thai offers a fusion of Indian and Thai cuisine that's sure to tantalize your taste buds. The menu includes a variety of curries, stir-fries, and noodle dishes, as well as a selection of vegetarian and vegan options. The atmosphere is relaxed and cozy, with colorful decor and friendly service.

address_obj.address_string: Unit B11 2 Fairview Towne Centre, Montego Bay Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #6 of 160 Places to Eat in Montego Bay

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Dine at Montego Bay's Finest Restaurant

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Eccellent Thai and Indian food under one roof. The food is of excellent quality and the staff is very helpful and polite. The drinks are verry good as well. The food is very traditional to the countries they represent while products are used.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: extremely Enjoyable

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
We hired Mystic Thai to cater our wedding after visiting the restaurant a number of times in the past. The service at the restaurant is fantastic and the food is some of the best Indian food I have ever tasted, it has the perfect balance of flavors and the very fresh ingredients. Since we had a great experience at the restaurant, we asked if they would be able to cater our wedding for 150 people about 90 minutes away from their restaurant. The catering request was a little complex because we had to feed our guests for three full days. Mystic Thia absolutely NAILED IT! Every one of the guests raved about the food. The presentation was perfect, it was one time, and any adjustments we needed were easily accommodated. 

It was also a great pleasure working with Karina. She is on top of everything with the team and helped make the event successful. She was even able to make some atypical traditional dishes that are not normally served at weddings. We gave her a recipe and they were able to turn it from a dish that serves 4-6 into a much larger production for all the wedding guests. I have worked in hospitality for over 10 years and Karina and her team provided some of the best food and service I have ever experienced. We went to many different places to find the perfect caterer and none of them compared to Mystic Thai.  My wife and I are super grateful that we could work with her for the wedding. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for the best food and service in Jamaica.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: AMAZING Dining and Catering Experience!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: All over food ,arrangements were excellent. Obove expectations. Five star services everyday until we stayed.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Wedding

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The food and service was excellent! Specially the Indian street foods  were very delicious. Definitely recommend to Indian community looking for vegetarian dishes. We attended a destination wedding for about 200 ppl and had catered with them for 3 days and loved it!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great service and excellent food!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Our friends and family group of 6 enjoyed a wonderful dining experience at Mystic Thai. It's a lovely setting, with comfortable lighting and tables big enough for our group of 6 to be comfortable. Their menu is robust, with both Thai and Indian selections. So many choices! Our group started with drinks (my mango and Prosecco was delicious!) and ordered  7 appetizers because we could not make up our minds, and every one of them was yummy and very well-portioned for sharing. Don't miss the fried corn--we ordered another round, it was so yummy! And the celery and chicken dumplings (5 to an order) were juicy and moist. The crispy lamb was a hit with our lamb lovers, uniquely flavored and just a tad spicy. (spice can be adjusted to taste when ordering). Entrees were also excellent--well spiced, plentiful portions, and so nicely presented!  We shared 4 entrees, including shrimp pad Thai,  red Thai curry, pepper chicken and pork belly--and we ordered a few breads (naan) from the Indian menu. The naan alone is worth another visit--it was hot, fresh and so tasty. The owner, Karina, stopped by our table to make sure we were happy--a very nice touch. She is opening another restaurant in Kingston and we look forward to checking it out. It was a  WONDERFUL meal and we will make this a regular restaurant to visit when we're visiting Mo Bay.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: FANTASTIC DINING EXPERIENCE!

name: Pier One, Seafood Restaurant
description: With its prime location on the waterfront, Pier One is a must-visit spot for seafood lovers. The menu features a range of dishes made with the freshest catches of the day, including lobster, snapper, and shrimp. Dine indoors or outdoors, with stunning views of the sea and the city. Pier One also hosts live music and entertainment on select nights, making it a great spot for a night out.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Pier 1
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Pier 1 is Montego Bay's most pulsating open-air Seafood Restaurant, Bar and Entertainment Center that has been in operation since 1986. It is located on a picturesque peninsula in the heart of the bay allowing diners the perfect view for watching the cruise liners disappear into a brilliant sunset. Our restaurant is well known for its fusion of the intoxicating Jamaican Flavors by offering a wide variety of seafood dishes including the Pier 1 Lobster, our famous Coconut Shrimp and the Grilled Mahi-Mahi to name a few. For the lovers of the land, our menu captures the best of the Jamaican cuisine. From our perfectly Grilled Beef Tenderloin to the island favorite of Braised Oxtail, our vast menu has something for everyone. Like with our dishes, our four signature nights have found a way to fuse Jamaicans and Visitors by offering a unique entertainment package. Star Struck Wednesday Pier Pressure (Friday Night Party) Seafood Sunday- Grooving on the Pier Karaoke Mondays

address_obj.address_string: Howard Cooke Blvd, Montego Bay 00000 Jamaica

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Pier 1 Mega Pot- Lobster, Sea Crab, Shrimp, Corn on the cob and More!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: It was an extremely busy night and we had to get takeout instead of dining. Kaylie and Chin provided perfect service on what would have been an otherwise disappointing night. Thanks to you both!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Big up Kaylie and Chin!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The food here was fantastic and we had a good variety (i.e. chicken wings, salad with grilled chicken, fish, steak) and all was good.  The service was impeccable!  Will certainly be back on our next trip to Jamaica.  The people are so gracious there in Jamaica and they cater to providing excellent customer service.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Pier 1 is the 1!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This restaurant was highly recommended by the tour guide.  We had a reservation for 6.  The restaurant had no record of our reservation.  The 4 people behind us from the same resort had a reservation, again they had no record of it.  They tried to seat us in a small closed in room with no view and was hot.  We said no. We finally got seated in a nice spot by the water.  

The service was slow and the food just okay.   The menu was covered with lobster options.  When we all went to order lobster, there is no lobster available, because lobster season is August-September.  They should indicate that on the menu. 

Also the 4 people that I mentioned earlier got seated, waited a long while and got up and left.  

Would not recommend this restaurant.  Not to mention the taxi driver who the same tour guide lined up,  tried to charge us $120 for a 10 minute drive each way for six people.  

Very disappointing night. Would not recommend.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Overall not worth it

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Good evening, we apologize for the inconvenience you faced during your visit. We take our customer satisfaction very seriously and would like to make it right. 
Jamaica's Lobster 🦞 season is from July until March of every year and  it is also typed in our menu's as a seasonal item.
I would hope this does not affect your second visit to Pier1  and would love to see you soon for a different experience.
You can contact us at 8762752630 to further investigate this matter and also for future reservations contact 876286-7208 to book your reservations and have them secure.
Thank you again for your honest Reviews and thank you for making it pier1.
Marketing Department 
LD
owner_response.author: Pierone Montego Bay

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The place was not packed for a Saturday and the service was very slow. Everyone we asked recommended Pier 1 so we had very high expectations. We were disappointed with the dinks, the oxtails didn’t taste good and they were tough. The wings also were not good. name: Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville
description: For a fun-filled day in the sun, head to Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville in Negril. This lively spot boasts a swim- up bar, a waterslide, and a trampoline, as well as live music and entertainment throughout the day. Feast on tasty burgers, seafood, and tropical drinks while taking in the stunning beach views. Margaritaville also offers a variety of water sports and activities, including parasailing, jet skiing, and glass - bottom boat rides.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Negril
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Stroll down the white-hot strip of famous 7-Mile Beach to our iconic yellow flip flop. Known as the “Capital of Casual”, the laid-back, cool atmosphere of Negril makes this piece of paradise a favorite of Jimmy and sun-seeking travelers alike. Sparkling sugar sand, crystalline warm waters, and sunsets unlike anything you’ve ever seen are only a few of the attraction Negril has to offer. Experience private cabanas for lounging beachside, a rustic Tiki Beach Bar serving up endless island-inspired refreshments, and open-air dining with a menu so delightful, the fish won’t be the only ones biting. This town may have inspired Buffett’s “Jamaica Mistaica”, but make no mistake, you’ll find your slice of heaven at Margaritaville Negril. People watch with a frosty margarita in-hand, get air on our water trampolines, and get down with a sensational mix of island music, pumping through the air all day long. Exchange your worries and shoes, for barefoot fun in the sand and surf, the entire fami

name: Cinnamon Hill Golf Course At Rose Hall
description: Golf enthusiasts will love the Cinnamon Hill Golf Course at Rose Hall. This stunning course is located on a historic 18th-century plantation and features 18 holes, as well as beautiful views of the Caribbean Sea and the Jamaican mountains. The course is suitable for both novice and experienced golfers and offers lessons and rentals.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Cinnamon Hill Golf Course
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Cinnamon Hill's diverse elevations offer a great combination of both links style and inland golf. Feel the cool ocean spray on your cheeks as you play alongside the Caribbean Sea, then hear the wind whistling through the pines as you tee-off on holes 16 and 17, 350 feet above sea-level. On the closing stretch, tight fairways are dotted with treacherous, strategically placed bunkers, inspiring the most competitive player’s best game. This is a test you will enjoy - enchanting panoramas framing your every shot.The Caribbean Sea can be viewed from 17 of the 18 holes and the one hole where it’s absent a majestic waterfall awaits your errant tee shot. The waterfall is the site where they filmed James Bond’s Movie Live and let Die and is only one component of the great history that is on the course. On hole #14 the winter home of country music superstar Johnny and June Cash can be seen from the fairway. As an added enhancement, one of the course’s biggest assets happens to be its expert caddies. Cinnamon Hill caddies are listed among "The Best In The World" by Golfer Magazine. Each caddy is expertly trained and ready to help you improve your game.Come, experience Cinnamon Hill and add your own story to its intriguing history. This challenging par 72 layout which plays just over 6800 yards from the tips has 4 sets of tees that offer a great experience for all levels of players from juniors to seniors.Proud Host of the 2010 LPGA Tour event ‘The MOJO 6”Rated by Golfweek as a Best Tour Courses you can play. Rated at #29 right after The Blue Monster at Doral.Please note: All rates include green fee cart caddy and all taxes as well as use of the driving range, short game area and putting green. Our Nike VRS club rentals are $55 and come with a free sleeve of Nike Golf Balls and our Nike shoe rentals are $20.

address_obj.address_string: 1 Mount Zion Road, Rose Hall, Montego Bay Jamaica

He didn’t even want to put the golf ball on the t for me  when I asked because I had tweaked my back. At one point he left his job which was to be of help to me and went off to go and speak with his friend. I drove off in the golf cart. He gave away my balls and he had the nerve to have an attitude and ask me for a tip. In fact he and his friend came to my car and asked me for a tip. I am a very busy woman and so I didn’t have time to review this establishment until now. But if you are a woman of color traveling solo. I would not recommend it. I was there on January 4 2023. I can’t remember his name but I assure you. He is not a good caddy.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Played a round here Christmas day with my family of 4 adults.  We are all avid golfers of varying skill levels and we all loved the experience.  Mike and Al were our caddies and these guys were absolute beauties!  Their helpful insights and ability to read greens made our round so much more enjoyable.  The course is a mix of ocean view holes and mountain holes with lush jungle everywhere.  The ancient relics from the old sugar refinery give the course real character.  The Callaway rentals were fine and the course conditions were good.  The greens were very fast with subtle breaks that made them challenging yet fun.  I would highly recommend playing here if you have the opportunity!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Great Track.  Can't wait to go back!

name: Half Moon Golf Club
description: Another top golf destination in Jamaica is the Half Moon Golf Club. This award-winning course boasts 18 holes and was designed by renowned golf architect Robert Trent Jones Sr. The course features beautiful views of the Caribbean Sea, as well as lush tropical foliage and natural lagoons. Half Moon Golf Club also offers a golf academy, lessons, and rentals.

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I found the golf to be in great shape. My Caddie Mark was great and knew the greens and gave great advice. The best thing was when the head pro Kevyn Cunningham came up to me and gave me some awesome and insightful things to work on and they have helped a lot. I really  recommend playing and getting advice from Kevyn and his staff.
Happy golfer Doug
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Awesome experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
I took a 2 hour lesson with Kevyn at Half Moon Golf Club and it was worth every penny. What a great experience Kevyn evaluated my swing and identified the glaring problems (weak grip, outside take away, steep swing path, swaying lower body) and we worked on drills I could do anywhere to help correct the bad habits. We finished the lesson with a 5-minute video where I recorded Kevyn demonstrating the drills, we worked on worked on and detailing how to structure a practice session at the range. I started the lesson at 10AM and it was HOT if your sensitive to heat make sure to drink a lot of water the day before and the day of the lesson. 

My biggest problem going into the lesson was slicing off the tee and I played 9 holes 2 days after my lesson with Kevyn, I was hitting my 3w dead straight off the tee to the point that the caddie said “man you’re really crushing that club”. It made me laugh and I responded you should have seen me before the lesson. I highly recommend stopping in for a lesson if you’re in Montego Bay the course and staff are incredible and Kevyn is a fantastic teacher.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Amazing 2 hour lesson with Kevyn

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Lessons at Half Moon Golf Club with Kevyn are a must! I visited Jamaica in February and decided to take a lesson with Kevyn on the Wednesday of my trip. He was tons of fun, engaging and explained all of the logic behind the swing. The lesson went so well I went back for two more - he completely transformed my swing (see before and after photos)! If you want dramatic results in a very short time period there is no one better! 

In our last lesson we went out on the course and it's beautiful and extremely well maintained. The staff are also really friendly and helpful. 

I've recommended Kevyn and the course to several friends who traveled to Jamaica in April and I'm already planning my trip back ! Must do in Jamaica and beyond highly recommend!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Fantastic instruction and beautiful course!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: The Half Moon Golf Club is absolutely first class.   Kevin Cunningham and his team make every effort to ensure that 'your' experience is a special one.    The attention to detail and time that he gave me whilst I was lucky enough to be in Jamaica for 5-weeks was outstanding.    The course, itself, was very forgiving, as long as you hit the right shot and did not go off line!   I would absolutely recommend the resort for not only couples that are looking to get away to play golf, but it is a definitely a must-do if 'the lads' are visiting Jamaica on a golf-trip.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: 'GOLF IN PARADISE'

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We love this course- have been playing here for over 25 years and it's always in excellent shape- The caddies are terrific and really know their greens- this year I decided to take a lesson w/the pro-Kevin Cunningham and he was fantastic- I only wish I could take more!!! In an hour he fixed something in my swing that had been bothering me for a year!!!!!! Next year will return and take another lesson for sure!

name: White Witch Golf Course
description: Designed by Robert von Hagge and Rick Baril, this picturesque course is set on 200 acres of rolling countryside in Montego Bay. The White Witch Golf Course features 18 holes with sweeping views of the Caribbean Sea, elevated tees, winding fairways, and fast greens, making it a popular spot for experienced golfers.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: White Witch Golf Course
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Situated on the historic 4,000 acre Rose Hall Estate, and sited on 200 acres of lush greenery and rolling countryside, The White Witch Golf Course is carved from the rolling countryside of Jamaica’s historic Rose Hall Plantation and is an 18-hole championship golf course designed by Robert von Hagge and Rick Baril. This 6,758-yard, Par 71 treasure is named for the plantation’s beautiful but wicked 19th century plantation mistress, Annee Palmer. Legend has it that Annee’s ghost still haunts the estate, creating an alluring mystique that has fascinated island natives and visitors for generations. Winner of the "Jamaica's Best Golf Course" award at the 2015 World Golf Awards, also rated as the #1 Golf Course and #1 in Golf Shop Staff service by Conde Nast Traveler. The White Witch is considered one of the finest golf courses in the Caribbean, characterized by mountainous terrain, cool trade winds, colorful foliage and spectacular ocean views from 16 of its 18 holes.

address_obj.address_string: White Witch Drive, Rose Hall, Montego Bay Jamaica

name: Rose Hall Great House
description: If you're interested in Jamaican history and architecture, be sure to visit the Rose Hall Great House in Montego Bay. This impressive Georgian mansion dates back to the 18th century and is surrounded by beautiful gardens and grounds. The house is said to be haunted by the ghost of Annie Palmer, the so- called "White Witch of Rose Hall," and visitors can take a spooky night tour of the mansion. The Rose Hall Great House also offers daytime tours, as well as a museum and gift shop.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Rose Hall Great House
tripAdvisorDetails.description: The greatest of Jamaican great houses, the Rose Hall Great House has a story with all the elements of an engaging novel. Built in 1770 by John Palmer and his wife, it eventually became the residence of their grandnephew, John Rose Palmer. In 1820, Palmer married Annee, a beautiful but feisty English girl. Little did John know that his young wife possessed “black magic” powers that would eventually lead to his demise. During her reign as mistress of the plantation, Annee did away with two more husbands and countless lovers. “The White Witch of Rose Hall” has fascinated generations, and even today, there are those who claim to see Annee passing through the Great House. A candle-lit evening tour of the Rose Hall Great House is a must for visitors to Montego Bay. Your guided exploration of the former home of Jamaica’s White Witch, Annee Palmer, includes captivating and chilling stories of love, murder and mystery skillfully told by knowledgeable guides. You’re sure to feel goose bumps as these eerie tales come to life in this grand estate, where ghost sightings have been reported over the years. Tours also give historic insight into this grandest of Jamaican great houses, now beautifully restored with 18th-century decor and antiques. To conclude this fascinating adventure, you can visit the dungeon, now transformed into a tavern called Annee’s Pub. Many visitors find that the famous rum cocktail, known as “Witches Brew” helps banish the spirits of ghosts or black magic they sense still lingering in the mansion.

Took our 13yo daughter who enjoyed the tour and was also amused.  

Tour went for around 40 minutes and was a great way to break up our drive to Ocho Rios!

name: Luminous Lagoon (Glistening Waters) Night Tour
description: Experience a natural wonder at the Luminous Lagoon Glistening Waters. This bioluminescent bay is home to tiny organisms that emit a bright blue light when agitated, creating a stunning and unique sight at night. Take a boat tour of the lagoon and watch as the water around you lights up like stars. It's a truly magical experience that you won't want to miss.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Glistening Waters Luminous Lagoon Tour
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Welcome to Glistening Waters Hotel, Restaurant & Marina. Situated along the Northcoast of Jamaica, and located in beautiful Famouth, Glistening Waters Luminous Lagoon is known around the world as Jamaica's only night-time attraction! Come out and experience what nature has to show you at this remarkable spot, where you will witness a phenomenon that only occurs in certain parts of the world.

address_obj.address_string: Falmouth Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #6 of 22 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Falmouth

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: I dont think they even want to jump in, if they saw the colour of the water :)

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This lagoon is one of only 4 in the world where the water glows when it’s disturbed. Swimming in this comfortable water is an amazing experience, and one I won’t forget. 

You receive free rum punch while you wait for it to get dark and can enjoy the sunset. Once on board, Capital Vincent was super fun and knowledgeable about the area and the science behind this natural wonder. Gave ample time to swim around and really experience the unique glow of the water.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Unique, Fun Experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We booked this excursion through our butler at Jewel Grand and it was seamless pick up and drop off. This experience was phenomenal, however, we did have to wait for over an hour to get on the boat. The actual boat organizing was chaotic at best. Once on the boat we had a great time and really enjoyed the beautiful water. Captain Jerry had a lot if information. It was one of the most beautiful things I've ever see, and done, just don't make dinner reservations for after your trip as you'll likely be late.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Glisteningly Slow Lagoon

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We took this tour starting fr run a way bay. 35 min drive each direction. Tour had about 20 people on the boat . Started promptly and host was knowledgeable.  20 min in the water and the experience was amazing. I did not touch the bottom as it was muddy .  It’s only 4 ft deep or so. Warm like a tub .
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Excellent choice to choose

tripAdvisorReviews.text: On March 31st 2023, my Husband and I did the Bioluminescent Tour with Faithful Waters Luminous Lagoon Friday night.  It was a magical experience and a must see with the naked eyes.  The waters were warm and calm.  It was certainly amazing to see the bioluminescent creatures come alive once the waters were activated.  A truly spectacular moment to see!  It was cool to know the water level was only 4 feet deep.  Our Boat Captain Eric was very nice and allowed us time to take it all in.  Many thanks to the team and Craig for coordinating this wonderful experience for my Husband and myself!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A Magical Experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was an excellent experience with a friendly and knowledgable captain. Thankfully, we did not encounter any creatures underwater and managed to enjoy swimming in the lagoon. 

Would recommend bringing towels and change of clothes as the muddy water can get slightly smelly but it is bearable.

name: Martha Brae River Rafting
description: For a peaceful and scenic adventure, go on a river rafting trip down the Martha Brae River. Relax on a bamboo raft as your expert guide navigates the calm waters and points out the local flora and fauna. You'll also have the opportunity to stop along the way to shop for local handicrafts and enjoy some delicious Jamaican food.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Martha Brae River
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
Float along the Martha Brae River in the heart of the Jamaican countryside. travelers will love gliding on the bamboo raft through the jungle, where wildlife and historic sites abound. During the hour-long ride, you can get on and off the raft as you please to swim in the river’s calm and crystal-clear waters. The guides will tell you all about the local plants and animals and the area’s history as you pass through the lush vegetation along the way. 

Most guided tours include round-trip transportation from Montego Bay. – Tripadvisor

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A relaxing ride down the river on a bamboo raft. Captain gave us loads of facts about the river and the surrounding area. A little hard sell of some hand made art at the end, could be a little awkward if not expected. As you are almost feel guilty not to buy something.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A beautiful and peaceful experience with great photo options. Very relaxing. Unique and wonderful. Rain or shine this is a must. After, please visit Luminous Lagoon for dinner and a night swim.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: We came to Falmouth on a cruise ship (Nieuw Amsterdam) and booked a Martha Brae River Rafting Tour. The rafting was actually quite nice although we had to wait quite a while at the "base" to go on the trip. Our "Captain" was very friendly and knowledgeable. So much for the rafting. After completion of the rafting we were bused to "Main Street" which we thought was Falmouth but in fact was a sketchy shopping centre half an hour drive away. Total waste of time. We were looking for some local experience, not the usual tourist traps, but this did not work out as expected. If you want to have a real local experience you will have to go on your own.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: My husband and I booked this excursion for while we were in port during our cruise. It was our first time in Jamaica. Our Raft Captain was Reynaldo aka Rastah Pastah. He shared a wealth of knowledge of both, Martha Brae River and Jamaica. He kept us entertained with his awesome singing! We could have stayed on the raft all day with him. I highly recommend this excursion to anyone visiting Jamaica. You won't be dissapointed. Yea mon!

Take a guided tour and learn about the history of the caves, including their use by runaway slaves and smugglers. The Green Grotto Caves are a must-visit destination for anyone interested in Jamaica's natural and cultural heritage.

name: Dunn's River Falls & Horseback Riding
description: For an adrenaline-pumping adventure, combine two thrilling activities into one with a trip to Dunn's River Falls and horseback riding.First, climb the famous Dunn's River Falls, a series of cascading waterfalls that are both beautiful and exhilarating. Then, hop on a horse and ride along the beach and through the lush Jamaican countryside. It's an unforgettable experience that combines the best of nature and adventure.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Dunn's River Falls and Park
tripAdvisorDetails.description:
The unique terraced Dunn’s River Falls is a refreshing adventure in the Jamaican jungle. Get a tour guide to help you navigate through the pools and to the giant staircase waterfalls—if the going gets too tough, there are points at which you can give up and walk along the adjacent path.

The falls are a popular stop for cruise boats that pass through the area, so if you’re planning on visiting on your own, you’ll want to get there early in the morning for fewer crowds. Afterward, cross the highway and dry off on the golden sand at Dunn’s River Beach. 

– Tripadvisor

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: We can get you there in time and comfort

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I really liked climbing the falls and just enjoying the beach and relaxing with my friend. This was really a good experience
tripAdvisorReviews.title: All Fun

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
You climb the falls. These are much easier than they look online. The guides will help you if you need it. They start everyone off holding hands as a safety measure. This is actually less safe than just a couple going up together and after about 50 feet everyone realizes it. Following the guide is not a bad idea because they will have you do some fun things…and take pictures too that you can purchase later. We went with a group and a couple of is had waterproof cell holders which was great because you can go and get pictures of your own how you like. 
Don’t forget water shoes and a waterproof cell phone holder. With the amount of people even on a non-cruise day in April it almost seemed like an attraction in an awesome amusement park. They say the dark rocks are slippery but there wasn’t a lot of them and I didn’t see anyone having problems.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Unique experience

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Booked a TUI day trip to Dunns River Falls in the morning and then Bob Marley in the afternoon.
On arrival our tour guide escorted us to the entrance and got our tickets. Quick and straightforward no hanging about then our Falls guide Patrick bigfoot arrived with Craig who filmed our climb. My knees aren't that good in the UK damp weather so I was a little worried if they were big steps I would be able to do it. I told Patrick and he took me by the hand and pulled me up with a push from behind from my fella. We made it. We had a few photo stops on the way up and the guide made it fun. Probably about 20 of us in our group. Seemed to go really quick and although we were told it wasn't that busy I thought it was. Well worth a visit and special thanks to Patrick for getting us up there. There are a couple of escape routes if you can't make it all the way or if you dont want to get wet you can walk a path to the side. The beach is beautiful and the trees and surroundings. We worn water shoes not water socks well worth it only slipped once which was my fault as I didnt step where my guide stepped. There are lockers and changing places toilets. We left our stuff on the mini bus. We took a waterproof camera and people took their phones in waterproof plastic pouches around their necks. Also to tip your guide they will come back to the car park or you could use your waterproof pouch.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Good fun in beautiful surroundings

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
Take a water proof phone bag as well as water shoes along if going here 
You may want to be in reasonable shape to climb up it
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Fantastic time

tripAdvisorReviews.text: I didn't complete my adventure to many rocks to climb. I enjoyed the rain forster.  The water was cold at first. But it became a great body exercise walking.  I would not do it again. I'm to old now

name: Blue Hole Mineral Spring
description: Take a dip in the Blue Hole Mineral Spring, a natural pool with crystal-clear blue water that is said to have healing properties. The spring is located in a lush tropical garden and surrounded by limestone cliffs, making for a stunning and peaceful setting. You can also enjoy the on-site restaurant and bar, as well as other activities like zip lining and cliff jumping. It's a truly unique and refreshing experience.

tripAdvisorDetails.name: Blue Hole Mineral Spring
tripAdvisorDetails.description: Blue Hole Mineral Spring sits 24 feet below the ground in a cavernous opening completely encased by Karst limestone. The natural mineral water in the spring is 35 feet deep; However, the edges of the spring are shallow for guests to stand or sit down. Thrill seekers and staff entertain guests with dives only a daredevil can perform. Some guests jump into the spring, others choose to climb in using a safe iron ladder. Naturally occurring minerals in Blue Hole Mineral Spring are recognized for their therapeutic value. Guests often enjoy a Blue Hole Mineral massage where staff will purify, exfoliate, and soften your skin. Reviewers sure seem to be pleased with the results.

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Super chill spot with exhilarating jumps and fun music. Best food we’ve had on our trip as well. Wonderful family owned place, where the founder’s son entertains you with wild flips into the hole. Memorable spot off the beaten path
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Exhilarating and delicious!

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
It was an experience getting to the Blue Hole located just outside of Negril. Roads are narrow and bumpy so make sure you have a good driver. 

When we arrived we were pleasantly greeted and paid our entrance fee ($20 US per person) to swim. You can go in both the Hole and in the swimming pool, which both contain the same mineral water. 

I’m 62 and was nervous about going down the steps (and coming back up), but was reassured it was safe and a guide came with me both ways. The females all got a limestone scrub while enjoying the cool mineral waters. 

Something fun to do on a hot day!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Unique Mineral Spring

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Fun, respectful staff, absolutely beautiful grounds. The trip to even get there was an adventure! Takes a special person diving into the unknown but oh so worth it!!! A must do and very affordable!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This is an incredible place! The pictures and videos online do not do it justice. We needed an escape from the beach while on vacation and came here. The staff was very genuine and honest, really good people. You get an unofficial guide for your experience. We had Geddy who was absolutely amazing. We gave him our phone and he managed to swim all around in the water taking multiple pictures of us and somehow never got our phone wet. There was another guy named Tonto who very awesome as well. They are not pushy for a tip, so make sure you tip them well. They also have a locker room, but it wasn’t needed as the staff we encountered were very honest and attentive. They also have a pool and rooms you can rent as well as a bar. These were some of the best people we met while visiting this beautiful country!
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A place you need to experience!

name: Swamp Safari Tour
description: Embark on a thrilling adventure through Jamaica's untouched wetlands with the Swamp Safari Tour. Board a flat-bottomed boat and glide through the dense mangrove forest, keeping your eyes peeled for the local wildlife, including crocodiles, giant crabs, and exotic birds. Learn about the ecosystem of the swamps and the importance of conservation efforts to preserve this unique habitat. The Swamp Safari Tour offers a truly immersive and educational experience, perfect for nature lovers and adventurers alike. Don't miss the chance to explore this hidden gem of Jamaica.

address_obj.address_string: Foreshore Road Trelawny, Falmouth Jamaica

ranking_data.ranking_string: #4 of 14 things to do in Falmouth

tripAdvisorPhotos.caption: Our guide holding baby crocodile taken from one of the tanks in the cage behind him

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Would not recommend.  It was a 2hr bus ride (not their fault, but this added to our negative experience) for a 30 minute guide, and half of it was just watching a video.  They made it seem like we could hold the alligators or interact with the animals. None of that happened. Very run down, small enclosures.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Not worth the money or travel time

tripAdvisorReviews.text: Very run down and dilapidated. The animal enclosures are poor  and the range of animals is very small. The James Bond film footage was great. Our guide was very friendly and very informative. But the overall feeling was disappointment because of the poor state of the enclosures
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Run down and dilapidated

tripAdvisorReviews.text: This is a great attraction!  I live in Jamaica so whenever family or friends visit I take them there. It is quite run down now due to lack of support, economic conditions and COVID. Regardless, it’s still worth a visit and the tour guides are dedicated and informative and the crocodiles spectacular. It really needs more support and an injection of capital to get it back to its original state.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A must do while in Falmouth

tripAdvisorReviews.text:
This was the last stop of our customized itinerary with Chester’s Tours, and it was definitely a unique experience as we got the opportunity to handle both a snake and a baby crocodile, which made for some cool photo opps.  Lots of interesting animals to see, and you will have the opportunity to take plenty of pictures.  

Our guide was laid back and informative and I would recommend you check it out even if you don’t know anything about the Bond stuff, as we aren’t fans but still had an enjoyable time.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: Cool photo opps

tripAdvisorReviews.text: A must for any Bond fan! We had a tour of the property which included birds, snakes, deer, and of course, crocodiles. A visit to each pen with the finale ends up at the Live and Let Die location of the infamous running over the crocodile scene. Everything apart from the rollback bridge exists along with Katanga's building which was rebuilt after filming. Our guide Donald was present at the time when the scene was filmed.
tripAdvisorReviews.title: A must see for any Bond fan
